UNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS • DIVISION OF COMMUNICATIONS • URBANA
Office of the Dean
September 17, 1952
Mr. Graydon Ausmus
WUOA Radio Station
University of Alabama
University, Alabama
Dear Graydon:
Thank you for your very gracious letter
of September 15.
Jim has been able to arrange an extension
of his leave from Purdue and is planning to move into
the little house by October 1st. Thus we shall have a
house ready for his successor.
My advice to you is that you do not plan
the large seminar type of meetii^gJToj* mid-October, but
rather postpone it until after th| convention.
My further advice is that you call together
the committee on the directorship in mid-October only
if by that time you have two or three strong candidates
who look as though they would be satisfactory and whom
you could call in at the time of the meeting for an
interview. If you do not have such candidates by that
time, I suggest that you postpone the committee meeting
until the days just before the convention.
Finally, I hope you will let me know if
you have changed your mind about your own availability.
With very best wishes, I am
Sincerely yours,
Wilbur Schramm
Dean
